availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: A Kentucky physician. Graduated from the Medical Department at Transylvania University in 1830. Married to Maria Bradford. Father of Thomas Stuart Bradford, Lewis K. Bradford, and Laura A. Bradford. Practiced medicine in August, Kentucky. Served as a member of the Union Executive Committee of Kentucky in 1865.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bracken County, the west end of the City of Augusta; Donald A. Clark, “‘If Just One of the Boats Had Remained’: The 1862 Battle of Augusta and Its Aftermath,” Register of the Kentucky Historical Society, 115 (Winter 2016): 55-56; Transylvania Journal of Medicine and the Associate Sciences, vol. 3 (J. Clarke & Company, 1830): 38; “Johnathan Johnson Bradford,” (https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=55646757) (accessed January 30, 2017).
